title: Classic Baking Brands
description: Remember the trusted baking brands that helped create cherished family memories in the kitchen?

questions.question: Which baking brand featured a girl with an umbrella in the rain on its container of salt, with the slogan 'When it rains, it pours'?
questions.explanation: Morton Salt introduced the Morton Salt Girl and the slogan 'When it rains, it pours' in 1914, promoting their free-flowing salt that wouldn't clump in humid weather.

questions.question: Which flour brand featured a woman in a blue dress and was named after a character at the 1880 Minneapolis Millers Association flour exhibition?
questions.explanation: Gold Medal Flour won the gold medal at the 1880 Millers' International Exhibition and has used that name ever since. It's been a Washburn-Crosby (later General Mills) product.

questions.question: Who was the fictional homemaker created by General Mills in 1921 to answer consumer letters about baking?
questions.explanation: Betty Crocker was created in 1921 as a fictional character to give a personal touch to responses to consumer inquiries. She became one of the most recognized brand icons in America.

questions.question: Which brand's iconic Doughboy character, known for giggling when poked in the tummy, first appeared in 1965?
questions.explanation: The Pillsbury Doughboy, officially named Poppin' Fresh, first appeared in Pillsbury commercials in 1965. His signature giggle when poked became beloved by generations.

questions.question: Which baking chocolate brand featured a woman in a long dress carrying a tray of hot chocolate, an image used since 1780?
questions.explanation: Baker's Chocolate has used 'La Belle Chocolatière' image since the company's founding. It was America's first chocolate manufacturer, established in 1780.

questions.question: Which brand introduced the first boxed cake mix that originally only required adding water, but later added an egg requirement to make bakers feel more involved?
questions.explanation: Betty Crocker's early cake mixes included powdered egg, but sales were slow. Psychologist Ernest Dichter suggested requiring a fresh egg, making bakers feel more involved, and sales soared.

questions.question: Which brand of baking powder has featured a Native American woman on its label since the 1800s?
questions.explanation: Calumet Baking Powder has featured a Native American chief's headdress on its distinctive label since 1889. The name comes from the French word for the ceremonial peace pipe.

questions.question: What was the name of the iconic Nestlé chocolate chip cookie recipe printed on the back of every bag of their chocolate chips?
questions.explanation: The Toll House Cookie recipe, created by Ruth Wakefield at the Toll House Inn in 1938, has been printed on every bag of Nestlé chocolate chips and is America's most famous cookie recipe.

questions.question: Which sweetened condensed milk brand was essential for making no-bake pies and fudge, featuring an eagle on the label?
questions.explanation: Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk, made by Borden, was a pantry staple for decades. Its recipes for no-bake pies, fudge, and Magic Cookie Bars were kitchen favorites.

questions.question: Which brand's baking cocoa came in a distinctive orange and brown tin and was a staple for making homemade chocolate cakes?
questions.explanation: Hershey's Cocoa, in its iconic brown and silver tin, has been a baking staple in American kitchens since 1894. The recipe for Hershey's 'Perfectly Chocolate' cake was on every can.

questions.question: Which company published one of the most popular American cookbooks, first released in 1950, that became known as 'Big Red'?
questions.explanation: The Betty Crocker Cookbook, first published in 1950, became known as 'Big Red' for its distinctive red cover. It has sold over 75 million copies across all editions.

questions.question: Which brand of vanilla extract, known for its distinctive dark bottle, has been a baking cabinet staple since 1847?
questions.explanation: McCormick vanilla extract has been a kitchen staple for generations. McCormick & Company was founded in 1889 and became the leading spice and extract brand in America.

questions.question: Which shortening brand, introduced in 1911, claimed to be a healthier alternative to lard for baking and frying?
questions.explanation: Crisco, introduced by Procter & Gamble in 1911, was the first commercially produced all-vegetable shortening. It revolutionized American baking and was promoted as a modern alternative to lard.

questions.question: Which gelatin brand sponsored a popular recipe booklet featuring elaborate molded salads and desserts in the 1950s and 1960s?
questions.explanation: Jell-O published countless recipe booklets featuring elaborate molded salads and desserts that became staples of 1950s and 1960s entertaining and potluck dinners.

questions.question: Which cake mix brand was named after a real restaurant critic and food writer who became famous for rating restaurants across America?
questions.explanation: Duncan Hines was a real person, a traveling salesman who became famous for his restaurant reviews in the 1930s. His name was licensed for cake mixes starting in 1951.
